pages.text: Encrinus is a well known crinoid from the Upper Silurian to the Triassic period. It possessed a large crown like structure at the top of its stalk. Its arms had many pinnules on it and Encrinus may have been an active filter feeder. A small leathery dome covered the mouth and topped the cup and food would be transported from the arms to the cilia, which led to the mouth.
